Understate: The claim that "President Donald Trump won the 2020 election" understates the fact that Joe Biden has been projected as the winner by various sources and has received the majority of electoral votes.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the assertion that Trump won the election.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Trump won the election without acknowledging the official projections and results that indicate otherwise.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that Joe Biden won the election based on the Electoral College results and projections.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Joe Biden has been projected as the winner of the 2020 election by multiple sources and has received the majority of electoral votes.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not acknowledging the official projections and results that show Joe Biden as the winner of the election.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the possibility of Trump winning the election by not considering the official results and projections that indicate otherwise.
